title: Phlebotomist
description:
This is a PART TIME position (20 hours/week)

Schedule: Monday - Thursday, 3pm - 7pm + Saturday, 8am - 12pm

**Essential Job functions**:

* Uses appropriate aseptic technique to draw blood cultures.
* Processes Stat specimens according to Summit Health SOP.
* Prepares collection containers with appropriate preservatives for patients and gives instructions for proper collection of specimens at home (Urine & Stool). Properly measures and records a volume for a 24-hr collection.
* Properly collects a COC Urine Drug Screen.
* Properly administers and collects a H. pylori Breath test.
* Properly handles orders on minors.
* Uses the correct procedure for completing paperwork and labeling of specimen for OVH Blood Bank specimens.
* Processes satellite specimens and delivers them to the appropriate department.
* Monitors inventory levels and follows appropriate protocol for replenishing supplies in phlebotomy room and storage area.
* Deletes/cancels orders as necessary with full documentation of reason. Ensures proper patient charge deletion according to departmental policy.
* Recalls patients for follow-up procedures or error correction as required. Documents callbacks in the lab logbook.
* Utilizes LIS for all applicable functions to perform job duties, including downtime procedures.
* Adapts work schedule to meet emergency staffing needs.
* Required Competencies:
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of adult phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of pediatric phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in all areas of infant phlebotomy\\*
* Demonstrates competency in performing skin punctures\\*
* Demonstrates competency in performing bleeding times including entering the result in the LIS and the logbook.
* \\*Includes: Correct Order of Draw for multiple tube collection, using good judgment in evaluating specimens using established protocol, and demonstrating application of an adequate bandage to puncture site with explanation of puncture site care to patient.

**General Job functions:**

* Properly check-in a patient in a satellite lab, including arriving the patient on the day-list.
* Properly process lab and office collected specimens for transport to the main lab by courier.
* Contact a courier for a Stat pickup in a satellite office.
* Properly perform, log, and enter a result for a Rapid Strep and or Hemoccult test in the LIS. Notifies physician of critical (positive) result.
* Trains new staff in proper lab policies and procedures.
* Other job duties as required.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking)

**Environmental Risks:**

* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients / Visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens is possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:** 

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Minimum of 2 years of phlebotomy experience required and drug screen collection preferred.
* Has the ability to perform all testing required at our satellite locations.
* Phlebotomy Technician Certification through the National Health Career Association (NHA) preferred; may be required for specific locations based on operational needs.
* CLA Certificate preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology, HIPAA guidelines and laboratory requirements to include skills in phlebotomy techniques with adult, pediatric, and geriatric patients, computer/data entry skills and phone etiquette are required.
* Attention to detail, ability to critically think, multitask, and maintain accuracy during periods of frequent interruptions in a fast-paced environment.
* Consistently demonstrate the ability to communicate in a clear and effective manner and read/follow procedures accurately.

**Travel:**

* Travel to satellite locations as needed.

Job Type: Part-time

Benefits:

* Health savings account
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid sick time
* Paid training

Schedule:

* Every weekend
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* working in a medical office or lab: 2 years (Preferred)
* working as a Phlebotomist: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Phlebotomy Technician (Preferred)

title: Cyber Security Analyst - Only W2
description:
**Cyber Security**

Location – New Jersey

Information Technology (IT)

**Job Type**

Contract- Hire

**Length:**

6month

Only GC and Citizens

**Role**

Do you have a knack for information security? Are you at your best when you need to analyze information security related incidents? We’re looking for someone like that to:

– Analyze malware samples to understands its behavior, assess threat actor motivations, and extract indicators of compromise (IOCs)

– Act upon threat intelligence provided by Cyber Threat Intelligence function

– Respond to Information Security related queries

– Perform cyber threat hunting for the detection of advanced threats

– Mentor and train junior analysts to enhance the overall technical skillset of the SOC, establish analytic discipline and critical thinking, and promote greater curiosity – thinking "outside the box"

– Expand, tune, and enhance rulesets – SIEM, IDS, etc. – to identify security incidents and reduce false positives

– Investigate IOCs provided by Cyber Threat Intelligence or the Cyber Hunter function

– Handling incidents – encompassing multiple functions: detection and identification, incident triage, network and host-based forensic analysis, root-cause analysis, containment, system hardening, etc.

**Team**

The security operations center is a global team with people in Singapore, Hyderabad, Zurich and New Jersey. We are involved in different type of information security incidents (phishing, malware, denial of service, inappropriate usage and unauthorized access). We are a young and empowered team who always drives for continuous improvement.

**Your experience and skills**

You have:

– A natural ability to solve complex issues through analytical and lateral thinking

– Performed proactive hunting; have detected anomalous and potentially malicious activity in log data

– Master's degree in a STEM field with 3+ years of relevant experience; Bachelor's degree in a STEM field with 5+ years of relevant experience; or 9+ years of incident response, malware analysis, and threat detection

– Hands-on experience with content development and use-case management

– Proficiency in log parsing and data analysis (REGEX is a must)

– Proficiency in x86 assembly language, disassemblers, and debuggers

– Hands-on experience with Volatility or similar malware analysis/forensic tools

– Proficiency in static and dynamic malware analysis

– Demonstrable proficiency in code de-obfuscation and anti-forensic techniques

– Fluency in at least one compiled language (C, C++, etc.) and one scripting language (Python, Perl, etc.)

– A firm understanding of the TCP/IP stack and networking (knowing the difference TCP and UDP is not enough)

– Moderate to advanced understanding of DDoS attacks and mitigation techniques

– Fluent in English

Security Certifications

– GNFA, GCFE, GPEN, and GREM

– OSCP and OSCE must

title: Ophthalmic Technician
description:
**\\*\\* $1,000 Sign-On Bonus\\*\\***

  


**A career that changes lives.**



SightMD is a rapidly growing integrated ophthalmic provider group, extending the reach of exceptional eye care to patients across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. With over 127 eye care providers and the convenience of 60 locations, our commitment to delivering unparalleled services is at the heart of everything we do. As we embark on our mission, we are actively seeking teammates who are eager to contribute to our legacy of eye excellence, a tradition that spans more than 50 years.

  


**Position Summary:**



As an Ophthalmic Technician, you will play a vital role as an assistant to our physicians. You will be cross trained to perform a range of administrative and clinical duties. These duties include preparing the patient to see the physician, preparing examination rooms, performing basic and routine vision screening examinations, administering eye medications, cleaning, and maintaining ophthalmic instruments and assisting physicians during minor surgical and laser procedures.


**Job Duties & Essential Functions:**


* Meet and greet patients, gather medical history, and document findings.
* Perform a comprehensive range of pre-exam and advanced diagnostic tests (e.g., OCT, Fundus photography, visual field testing).
* Educate patients on medications and pre/post-operative care as directed by the physician.
* Assist with contact lens fitting and care instruction.
* Perform refractometry to determine refractive errors and assist with minor surgical procedures.
* Maintain inventory of ophthalmic supplies and instruments.
* Assist with clinical equipment upkeep and cleaning.
* Adhere to all safety protocols.
* Participate in continuing education to maintain best practices.
* Process prescription refills with proper authorization.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Required Qualifications:**


* High School diploma or equivalent required
* Excellent written, verbal, and listening skills
* Strong interpersonal, time management, and organizational skills
* Strong customer service skills
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Ability to stand for long periods of time
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience as an Ophthalmic Technician Assistant or one (1) year of specialized ophthalmic experience.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Ophthalmic Scribe Certification (OSC) required or completion within 45 days of hire
* Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) certification preferred or enrolled within twelve (12) months of hire and completion within two (2) years of hire.
* Ophthalmic Scribe Certification (OSC)

  


**Work Schedule:**


* Rotating Schedule – including days, evenings and weekends


**Hourly Pay Rate:**


* $24.50

  


**Benefits:**



We aim to take care of our teammates the same way we take care of our patients. All SightMD employees receive the following benefits:


* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Prescription Drug Coverage
* Company Paid Term Life Insurance & Long-Term Disability
* Supplemental Insurance Benefits
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Retirement Plan - 401(k)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Holidays
* Career Development Programs


* ***All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.***

  


**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:**



SightMD is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, familial status, pregnancy, predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, domestic violence victim status, criminal conviction, and all other protected classes under federal, state and local laws.



If you are an individual with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact People Services at peopleservices@sightgrowthpartners.com

The position will be contracted from the beginning of October through mid-December. This could be a long-term position for the right FT nanny, who would stay on retainer from October through December and travel with the family for a few weeks (domestically) during those months.

title: Part-Time CNC Flatbed Operator (Night Shifts)
description:
11th Street Workshop is a leader in the design, build and fabrication space for luxury brand retail spaces, events, photoshoots and productions. Dedicated to delivering high-quality products and exceptional service. We pride ourselves on fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. We are currently seeking a motivated and skilled CNC Flatbed Operator to join our team on a part-time basis during night shifts.  
Job Description  
As a CNC Flatbed Operator, you will be responsible for operating and maintaining CNC flatbed machines to produce precision components. Your expertise will ensure that our production goals are met while adhering to safety and quality standards.  
Key Responsibilities

* Operate CNC flatbed machines to produce parts according to specifications.
* Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, and work orders.
* Set up machines for production runs, including tool changes and adjustments.
* Monitor machine operations to ensure quality and efficiency.
* Perform routine maintenance and troubleshooting of equipment.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area.
* Adhere to all safety protocols and company policies.
* Demonstrates keen attention to detail and thoroughness
* Reviews assigned tasks & reports back to the Programmers and/or Department Manager with questions, comments, and concerns

Qualifications

* High school diploma or equivalent; technical training in CNC operations is a plus.
* Previous experience as a CNC operator or in a manufacturing environment preferred. 1 years of CNC operation (Loading material, changing tooling, running programs, routine machine maintenance)
* Proficient in reading and interpreting technical documents.
* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Willingness to work night shifts and flexible hours.
* Familiarity with a variety of sheet goods (Plywood, MDF, Acrylic, Foam, etc)
* Knowledge of router bits (Different bits are used for different materials and tooling operations)
* Organized and capable of working semi-independently after being assigned a task
* Strong work ethic and drive to learn
* Experience with CAMaster or Biesse Machines a plus
* Experience with VCarve or Rhino Software a plus

Benefits

* Competitive hourly wage. Starting 25/hr Scales with experience
* Flexible scheduling for work-life balance.
* Opportunities for skill development and career advancement.
* Supportive and inclusive work environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $26.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 30 per week

Schedule:

* Night shift

* Jersey City, NJ 07307 (Required)

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
**Position Overview:**  
The Accounts Payable Specialist, working closely with Division Controllers, will be responsible for managing all aspects of the accounts payable process, ensuring that invoices are processed accurately and timely, and maintaining strong relationships with vendors. This role is crucial to the smooth operation of our financial processes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Review and verify invoices for accuracy and proper authorization.
* Enter invoices into the accounting system and ensure proper coding to the general ledger.
* Prepare and process electronic transfers and payments.
* Reconcile vendor statements and resolve any discrepancies in a timely manner.
* Maintain accurate and organized records of all accounts payable transactions.
* Assist with month-end closing tasks, including accruals and journal entries.
* Communicate with vendors and internal departments to resolve invoice and payment issues.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures related to accounts payable.
* Support the finance team with additional accounting tasks as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field preferred, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience in accounts payable or a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices.
* Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Excel.
* Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Problem-solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development.

**How to Apply:**  
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter to hr@aaawholesale.com with the subject line "Accounts Payable Specialist Application - [Your Name]." Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

title: Global Partner Seller
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

This role is part of Service Now’s Global Partner and Channels (GPC) organization, dedicated to enabling & accelerating rapid growth through NOW’s partner ecosystem . This role is integral to our aggressive growth strategy and involves leading the sales efforts for large, embedded IT solutions in collaboration with our largest Service Providers. The ideal candidate will have executive gravitas, a strategic mindset, think like a CxO, and have a proven track record of qualifying, creating, and selling comprehensive IT solutions.


Critical to this role:


Strategic Vision and Leadership:

* Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to drive growth through large, embedded solutions
* Provide visionary leadership to shape the direction of sales strategies and market positioning
* Collaborate with executive leadership and Business Unit Owners to align sales strategies with overall business objectives


Large Solution Development & Sales:

* Participate in the creation and customization effort of large, Service Now embedded solutions tailored to the needs of a designated partner and their end clients
* Oversee the entire sales cycle from qualifying to closing large complex deals, ensuring a consultative and solution-based sales approach
* Present and demonstrate solutions to C-level executives & decision makers, articulating the value of Service Now & ROI


Collaboration & Integration:

* Work closely with cross functional teams, including workflow BU’s, technical consultants, marketing, and enablement to ensure seamless integration and delivery of solutions
* Coordination with your partner to co-develop and bring innovative solutions to market inclusive of solution identification, market potential, solution design, build, launch & track success.


Market Development:

* Identify, qualify & close large Service Now embedded solutions with your designated partner who will then market to their client base.
* Build and nurture relationships with key business owners and stakeholders
* Analyze market trends & competitor activities to identify new opportunities and areas of growth


Performance Management:

* Achieve sales targets and key performance indicators
* Monitor and report on sales performance, market trends & customer feedback
* Continuously improve sales processes and strategies to enhance efficiency & effectiveness

 **Qualifications**  

To be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

* Demonstrable track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets
* 10+ Years of experience in IT sales with a focus on large, embedded solutions and strategic partnerships
* Proven track record of successfully selling complex IT solutions to C-level executives and large enterprises
* Strong Strategic thinking and business acumen with the ability to think and act like a CxO
* Excellent communication, negotiation & presentation skills
* Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with strategic partners
* Deep understanding of IT markets, technologies, and trends
* Ability to travel as needed to meet with partners


For positions in New York City, we offer a base pay of $136,600 - $225,400, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.


**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.


**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Store Manager
description:
Spirit Halloween has one single goal, to deliver the very best Halloween experience possible to all of our guests. We are the largest seasonal Halloween retailer in the world and the premier destination for everything Halloween. Since being acquired by Spencer Gifts, LLC in 1999, we have grown from 63 locations to over 1,300 across the United States and Canada and service the globe on SpiritHalloween.com.

Every season our team works tirelessly to create new and innovative ideas in Halloween costumes, accessories, animatronics, decor and more utilizing the latest technology to dazzle even the most hardcore Halloween fans.

You will hit the ground running in this fun, fast-paced, challenging environment where every team member is an essential component of our success and everyone's voice is important in a culture built on respect, integrity and a community of giving back. title: Assistant Coordinating Manager
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Kings County Hospital Center has a rich legacy for its pioneering role in medicine. Today, with over 625 beds, our hospital remains on the cutting edge of technology and provides the most modern procedures with state-of-the-art equipment. Built in 1831 as a one room infirmary for publicly supported care of the sick, Kings County Hospital Center continues to be a leading healthcare facility whose mission is to provide care to everyone regardless of their ability to pay. The hospital provides a wide range of health services, and specialties are offered in all fields of modern medicine. More than 200 clinics provide a wide array of ambulatory care services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


**8:00 A.M – 4:00 P.M**

  

**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


**PURPOSE****OF****POSITION:**

* The purpose of this position is to assist the coordinating manager with all clerical oversight within the radiology department. The individual in this role will also collaborate with radiology leadership to devise and implement strategic administrative improvements.




**AREAS****OF** **RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Under direct supervision of the clerical coordinating manager and radiology director, perform daily operational and functional clerical duties within the radiology department.

**SUMMARY****OF****DUTIES****AND****RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Supervise the clerical staff, including any required disciplinary action if necessary.
* Provide financial clearance prior to Radiology studies (insurance verification/preauthorization).
* Liaison with Patients Accounts to rectify claim denials if needed.
* Assist with patient scheduling and registration as well as the confirmation of appointments.
* Prepare reports and other documents requested by the Associate Executive Director and the Chief of Service.
* Schedule repairs and maintenance of office equipment.
* Perform office functions such as answering phones, faxing, mail distribution and others as needed.
* Confirm radiology orders are in EMR (Electronic Medical Record).
* Support leadership in preparing documentation for accreditation and regulatory surveys.
* Ensure departmental compliance with TJC, CMS, DOH and other regulatory authorities.
* Contact patients or referring clinicians about radiological appointments and follow-up.
* Manage departmental inventory and reorder as necessary. Track expiration of vendors contracts and renew as needed.
* Coordinate with management of other departments (Medical Board, nursing, engineering, IT, telecommunications, housekeeping, HR, dietary, etc.) as necessary for departmental operations.
* Maintain departmental employee files, ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
* Assist with weekly payroll submissions. Liaison with the human resources and payroll departments.
* Investigate, evaluate and resolve administrative or operational problems affecting the work unit.
* Assist the Radiology director and the Chief of Service with various daily operational requirements including their appointment calendars as well as other clerical functions deemed necessary.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in Business Administration, Community Health, Psychology or related discipline with one year of full-time experience in a supervisory or administrative capacity in business management systems, general administration, health care and medical/patient systems administration; or,  

  

2. A satisfactory combination of education, training and experience.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the **"Apply Now"** button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week.
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans.
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees.
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts.
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities.
* Multiple employee discounts programs.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Full Time, Center-based
description:
**Job Overview:**

We are a leading ABA therapy center dedicated to providing exceptional services to children with autism and their families. We are currently seeking an experienced and passionate Clinical Director to join our team in Ramsey. As a Clinical Director with us, you will have the opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art facility, lead a group of collaborative BCBAs and BTs, and make a meaningful impact on the lives of children and families.

**Duties:**

* Provide supervision (including completing weekly review and updating client programming) for caseload of up to 6 clients
* Work with and provide oversight of Behavior Technicians to implement individualized treatment plans as per company standards and BACB requirements
* Provide parent training and support
* Conduct behavioral and skills assessments and design treatment programs for clients
* Provide supervision to BCBA supervisees
* Collect data and graph data as instructed using technological programs, such as Microsoft Excel or behavioral software (e.g., Central Reach)
* Provide support to the Clinical Director as necessary including interviewing and training BT staff, creating parent training materials, etc.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Possess a minimum of a Masters degree or national equivalent with a major in psychology, special education, Applied Behavior Analysis, or related field of study
* Have obtained certification as a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) or Board Certified Behavior Analyst – Doctoral (BCBA-D) as verified through the Behavior Analyst Certification Board
* A minimum of 1 year experience in working with children with autism
* Must be at least 21 years of age
* Able to work Monday through Friday from 8:15am-4:45pm

**Preferred Qualities**

* Additional certification as a BCBA-D, special education teacher, school social worker, or school psychologist in the state of New Jersey
* Fluent in Spanish or another second language

If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to enhance your skills, develop your career, and work alongside a supportive clinical team, we encourage you to apply today. Join our team where you can contribute to transforming lives through quality ABA therapy services.

title: Mental Health Counselor L- II-Metro
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals** 

NYC Health + Hospitals/Metropolitan is the community hospital of choice for residents of East Harlem, northern Manhattan, and neighboring communities. The hospital provides culturally-sensitive care in a welcoming and hospitable setting, emphasizing primary care medicine and utilizing the latest advances in medical science. Metropolitan delivers high quality health services with compassion, dignity, and respect to all, without exception. Since its founding in 1875, the hospital has been affiliated with New York Medical College, representing the oldest partnership between a hospital and a private medical school in the United States. Metropolitan is a part of the NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest municipal hospital and health care system in the country.

**Job Description** 

* Provide direct care to patients.
* Creates aggregate reports for program analysis.
* Interacts with stake holders to ensure efficient and effective processes.
* Collaborates with all members of the interdisciplinary team to develop and implement treatment plans and post hospital care plans.
* Provides orientation to new staff and updates incumbent staff of changes in policy, procedures, or standards.
* Provides information about and acts as linkage to available community resources.
* Ensures that staff documents all interventions and continuing care plans in patient's medical record in accordance with departmental and hospital policies.
* Gathers information as needed to complete monthly statistical reports for both the hospital and NYC Department of Mental Health.
* Conducts and/or attends individual, unit, departmental, intra/inter hospital, and community meetings as mandated by the administration and/or supervisor.
* Performs othe duties assigned by supervisor as needed.

**Minimum Qualifications** 

**Assignment Level I**  
1. A valid License or Limited Permit issued by the New York State Education Department to practice as a Mental Health Counselor.

**Assignment Level II**  
1. A valid License issued by the New York State Education Department to practice as a Mental Health Counselor; and

2. Two years of full-time, paid, professional experience providing direct client care in a behavior health setting.

**Assignment Level III**  
In addition to meeting the requirements for Assignment Levels II, Assignment Level III requires:  
1. Three additional years of post-licensure experience.

**How To Apply** 

Please apply directly to the job via our careers website at: careers.nychhc.org (job # 62882)

We offer a competitive benefits package that includes health benefits, retirement and pension plans, paid time off, professional development, and an employee perks program.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

title: Outreach Specialist
description:
**Job Overview**

Bridges Outreach, Inc. believes that Outreach Specialists are a key component to eradicating homelessness. We are looking for Outreach Specialists with caring hearts, a problem-solving approach, and a high attention to detail and data quality.

Reporting to the Program Manager, the Outreach Specialist will be responsible for traversing the City of Newark to identify and provide services to people experiencing unsheltered homelessness. The ideal Outreach Specialist candidate will have previous experience working with chronically homeless populations.

The Outreach Specialist will engage individuals with mental health diagnoses and substance use disorders and will establish many trusting relationships with individuals who have been homeless for several years with limited to no access to resources. The Outreach Specialist will successfully connect street homeless individuals to services and help to create goal plans aimed ultimately to establishing better overall health, housing, and independence.

This position requires a proactive individual with excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills. Most importantly, Bridges Outreach is looking for a person with a heart to serve. Additionally, Outreach Specialists will assist in the coordination of our weekly Outreach Runs. This will include the ability to train, onboard, and support volunteers supporting the outreach work.

**The shifts available are full-time, part-time and per diem in Newark, NJ:** 

**Shift: 12:00am to 8:00am**

Days: Sunday, Monday, Friday and Saturday

**Shift 4:00pm to 12:00am**

Days: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday (TBD)

**Shift 8:00am to 4:00pm**

Days: Saturday and Sunday (only)

**RESPONSIBILITIES of the Outreach Specialist, Project Connect:**

· To engage daily with individuals experiencing homelessness in a trusting and supportive relationship, providing emotional support and focusing on target goals.

To leverage non-coercive, trauma-informed practices to build that trust and establish oneself as a partner in their journey out of homelessness

· To encourage clients to access services for which they qualifying order to achieve goals on their service plans

· Providing immediate transportation to clients to urgent services when needed. This could include shelter transport or transport to a warming center/drop in center and more.

· Provide mobile case management services including:

· Orient clients to the services and requirements for services available

· Conduct initial intakes and assessment to determine client’s emergency  
and immediate needs

· Maintain contact with referral sources

· Act as a liaison between clients and agencies rendering services to  
clients within your caseload

· Participate in field visits and transport clients to medical/housing/mental health/substance abuse treatment appointments

· Engaging clients in a trusting and supportive treatment partnership, providing emotional support while maintaining professional boundaries.

· Participate in case collaborative meetings with Project Connect Staff

· Responsible for inputting accurate data in customized database

* Proficient in Google suite and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), HMIS a plus
* Outstanding written and oral communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong time management and organizational strategies; ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize efficiently
* Willingness and ability to work with diverse identities and lived experiences.
* Ability to lift 35 pounds

· Other functions as needed

**Competencies:**

· Communication Proficiency

· Pays extreme attention to detail

· Proactive

· Results Driven

· Ability to Multi-Task

· Strong notetaking skills

· TEAM PLAYER

**Education:**

Associate degree (preferred) or 2+ years of working in a human service setting (to include internship experiences).

**Experience:**

· Prior experiences working with an underserved population helpful (e.g., experience with mental health population, drug abuse counseling, life coaching, social work, etc.)

· Preferred: One year as a street outreach worker/ homeless services case manager or related experience

· Experience working in an environment with high client volume

· Sensitivity to economic and sociological barriers

· Crisis de-escalation certification (Plus)

· BSW (Plus)

**Requirements:**

Valid driver’s license with 0 points

Ability to be insured through company driver’s policy

90% plus travel required (company vehicle provided)

Bilingual (English/Spanish) PLUS'

**Job Type**: Full-time/Part-time/Per-diem

**Grant Funded Pay Rate**: Starting at $24.00 per hour.

Schedule:

* Available to cover shifts when needed.

title: IT End User Support Associate - Elevated Business Support
company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems.  

  

The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.
What we do:
As an IT End User Support Associate, you will be a member of the Elevated Business Support team providing dedicated Tier 2 support to the Bank’s Markets, Research & Statistics, Supervision, and Executive business areas. You will resolve requests and issues with computers, cellphones, software, and conference room technology, meet with business areas, review ticket volume, participate in software and application release management testing and planning, be a member of technology workgroups, and lead small projects.  

You will report to the IT End User Support Manager on the Technology Group’s End User Services team
Your role as IT End User Support Associate - Elevated Business Support:
Implements and supports scalable/flexible workplace technologies working in close coordination with the Bank's Technology Group, the Federal Reserve's System IT, and vendor service providers. Responsible for supporting all end-user technology. We seek a seasoned technology professional who is an individual contributor and:  

* Works independently with limited supervision and may manage projects / processes.
* Collaborates with, coaches and reviews the work of other team members.
* Problems and challenges faced are difficult and sometimes complex.
* Influences others regarding policies, practices and procedures.
* Tactical (40%) – focused on the plans to achieve goals and objectives – the “how”, Transactional (60%) – carries out defined steps or processes.
  

What we are looking for:* Demonstrated experience in independently providing “high touch” End User Support/Services with a broad technology portfolio.
* Proven ability to work with a team of onsite and remote support technicians.
* Demonstrated vendor management operations experience.
* Has practical knowledge of project and process management with the ability to drive programs to implementation.
* Strong knowledge of ticketing systems and SLAs such as ServiceNow.
* Experience analyzing and reporting data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions.


Salary Range: $140000 - $160000 / year*We believe in transparency at the NY Fed. This salary range reflects a variety of skills and experiences candidates may bring to the job. We pay individuals along this range based on their unique backgrounds. Whether* *you’re* *stretching into the job or are a more seasoned candidate, we aim to pay competitively for your contributions*.  

Our Touchstone Behaviors—Communicate Authentically, Collaborate Inclusively, Drive Progress, Develop Others, and Take Ownership—help shape the culture of the Bank. They also provide a shared language for how we work together and achieve success, and they set clear expectations for leading with impact at every stage of your career with us. Learn more.  

Benefits:
Our organization offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career:* Fully paid Pension plan and 401k with Generous Match
* Comprehensive Insurance Plans (Medical, Dental and Vision including Flexible Spending Accounts and HSA)
* Subsidized Public Transporation Program
* Tuition Assistance Program
* Onsite Fitness & Wellness Center
* And more
 *The New York Fed expects its employees to perform their duties with honesty, integrity, and impartiality, and without improper preferential treatment of any person.* Learn more about our code of conduct and conflicts of interest rules. *The* *Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a diverse workforce and to* *providing* *equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, or military service.* *We value accessibility for all candidates and are happy to provide an accommodation or* *assistance**. Please email us at* ny.leaves@ny.frb.org *and* *we’ll* *be glad to help.* *Please note, this is a dedicated e-mail box designed exclusively to* *assist* *applications with accommodation requests in relation to our recruiting process. All other inquires including the status of applications will not receive a response from this e-mail box.*

While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change. *This position requires access to confidential supervisory information (CSI) and/or Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) information. Access to CSI and FOMC information is limited to U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents, individuals who meet the definition of “protected individual” under 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(3), and certain other nonimmigrants. title: Picker/Warehouse Associate
description:
Job Title: Picker/Warehouse Associate

Company: Plymovent Corporation

Company Description:

Plymovent is a global, leading supplier of products, systems, and services for the extraction and filtration of polluted indoor air. We protect workers and the environment from hazardous vehicle exhaust and industrial fumes. Clean air is precious to us - and has been for more than 45 years. We take pride in designing and producing superior air filtration products that contribute to cleaner, safer, and healthier workplaces for employees around the world. Our mission: Clean air at work for everyone everywhere.

Job Summary:  
Plymovent is seeking a Picker/Warehouse Associate at our Cranbury, NJ facility, Monday through Friday, 7:30am to 4:00pm. This position will primarily handle and bundle aluminum rail pieces, typically 10 feet to 20 feet in length. The Picker/Warehouse Associate will also pick and package customer sales orders.

Duties:

* Review of weekly rail report with Warehouse Manager.
* Pull and bundle rail per each order’s requirements.
* Engage in heavy lifting activities to handle products safely and efficiently.
* Use of band saw to cut rail to length as needed.
* Accurately pick orders per order picking list.
* Wrap and pack all orders in a manner that will prevent damage during shipping.
* Palletize and stack completed orders appropriately.
* Report customer order fulfillment challenges/issues to Warehouse Manager.
* Operate a forklift.
* Load and unload trucks.
* Organize stock and maintain inventory.
* Report any observed safety concerns to Warehouse Manager.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment within the warehouse.
* Other duties as assigned based on operational needs.

Qualifications:

* 2 years experience in an order fulfillment or production setting.
* Ability to read and accurately complete picking lists, production orders and assembly/testing instructions.
* Mechanical aptitude with experience using hand and power tools, including a saw.
* Experience working with a MRP/ERP system.
* Forklift operation experience.
* Ability to lift up to 50 pounds frequently throughout the day.
* Capacity to multi-task and be detail oriented in a fast-paced environment.
* ISO 9001:2015 experience preferred.
* Ability to work independently and in a team.
* Strong verbal communication skills.

Join Plymovent Corporation as a Warehouse Associate and be part of our mission to provide clean air at work for everyone everywhere. If you are detail-oriented, physically capable of handling warehouse duties, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we welcome you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.50 per hour

Ability to Commute:

* Cranbury, NJ 08512 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Office Efficiency Specialist
description:
**About Us**

At Huggins Wood Floor Specialist, we don’t just create floors; we craft masterpieces. We’re the name behind some of the most iconic interiors across the globe, known for delivering the world’s widest and longest center-cut plank floors. When our clients desire a floor that turns heads and makes a statement, they turn to us. Our custom designs are more than just visually stunning—they are unmistakably Huggins. As the leading manufacturer of luxury wood flooring for both residential and commercial projects, our specialty lies in wide plank hardwood, pine, reclaimed wood, and custom parquet patterns. Whether it’s solid, engineered, unfinished, or prefinished, our floors are tailored to meet the exacting standards of each client. We pride ourselves on working one-on-one with clients throughout New Jersey and the greater New York City area, collaborating with top architectural and interior design firms. Our work has even graced the screens of major design and cable networks.

**Position Description**

We’re searching for an Administrative/Personal Assistant who will become the linchpin of our CEO’s daily operations. If you thrive on keeping the wheels turning smoothly, this role is for you. You’ll be the gatekeeper of communication—handling phone calls, emails, and scheduling meetings—ensuring nothing slips through the cracks. But that’s not all; you’ll also dive into the creative side by helping to craft and distribute our marketing materials, all while keeping our files and online documents impeccably organized.

This isn’t just a job; it’s a mission. You’ll need to bring your A-game every day—whether it’s your razor-sharp communication skills, your knack for detail, or your ability to think critically and analytically. In this role, self-motivation isn’t just a nice-to-have; it’s essential. And if you’re comfortable with basic math, you’ll fit right in.

We’re looking to fill this pivotal position within the next few weeks.

**Position Details:**

* Part-time: 20-30 hours per week with flexible scheduling options.
* Location: In-person at our Westfield, New Jersey office.
* Compensation: $15.13 - $16.00 per hour, depending on your experience.

Pay: $16.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

The program includes a nature-based curriculum with a focus on nature play and stewardship that includes opportunities to explore nature, art, and science, in deeper, more meaningful ways. title: Manufacturing Technician (Aseptic Processes/GMP)
description:
**Work Schedule (Define days,# of hours)/ Is Overtime offered or required?**

**Monday – Friday 8 -4:30 or 8:30 - 5 – needs to have some flexibility. May start earlier or later.**

**JOB SUMMARY:**

* The **Process Development Tech II** position exists for the processing of human, porcine and fat-based tissue products.
* It requires clean room gowning and working in a lab setting. The Process Development Tech II serves as a subject matter expert and ensures the continuous flow of processing activities.
* It requires lifting to 30 pounds of boxes and materials off racks.
* The position involves frequently sitting, walking, reaching, stooping, squatting, crouching, kneeling, crawling and stair climbing and has the ability to use fine motor skills to operate equipment and/or machinery.
* Attention to detail is necessary when testing, assessing, and processing tissue samples.
* In addition, the Process Development Tech II requires the ability to comprehend work instructions and safety requirements to enter information into work logs and existing computer systems.
* Finally, the position requires the ability to work with solvents, cleaners and disinfecting products in both clean room and non-climate-controlled environments.

**KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: DESCRIBE SCOPE: % of Time or Importance**

* Precisely follow company tissue requests, study designs, protocols and SOP’s for the complete processing of tissue based products 40
* Perform lab testing to demonstrate the ability of the product/device to function as intended (i.e. verification and validation of process). 15
* Assist in the development of processes for manufacturing and commercial tissue products. 5
* Work with the in-house manufacturing group to scale-up, validate, and transfer the commercial manufacturing process 5
* Monitor the performance of processes and equipment and make recommendations for continuous improvement 10
* Serve as a subject matter expert, provide guidance to junior staff
* Train new employees
* Operates heat sealers, biohazard laminar flow hoods, aspiration systems, weighing scales, orbital shakers, splitter, grinder, gerber table, mixers.
* Records information on batch records, equipment and cleaning logs, and other documents
* Maintains inventory of processing supplies
* Uses computers to enter data and generate reports

**Years of experience/education and/or certifications required:**

* Associate’s degree w/ 3-5 years of experience

**What are the top 3-5 skills requirements should this person have?**

* Excellent interpersonal skills to allow effective participation with project teams
* Understanding of Quality System Regulations (QSR)
* Ability to lift 25 pounds
* Essential Skills, Experience, and Competencies (includes Licenses, Credentials)
* Prior experience with using manufacturing equipment for the medical device industry
* Prior experience in development of tissue based products is a big plus
* Prior experience in aseptic processes
* Prior experience and understanding of GDP, and GMP

**What is a nice to have (but not required) regarding skills, requirements, experience, education, or certification?**

* Quality/ R&D experience

**What type of environment is this person working in?**

* Process Lab Environment – working with industrial machinery – processing at a higher level. Not Mfg, but not test tube.

title: Food Quality Specialist/Manager
description:
Quality Systems Manager Job Description

**The Quality Systems Manager will manage the food safety / quality (SQF) program of the industrial bakery in Newark, NJ and Clifton, NJ. Must be able to plan, organize schedule, and budgets in an efficient, productive manner. Focuses on key priorities. Effectively juggles multiple projects. Anticipates reasonable contingencies. Pays appropriate attention to detail. Must be able to manage personnel time.** 

· A ) industry.

· SQF, PCQI Practitioner; FSPCA, and HACCP Certifications.

· Knowledge of creation and management of Environmental and Allergens Programs

· Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, planning, and conflict resolution skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with strong analytical and critical thinking skills.

· Ability to prioritize tasks and delegate them when appropriate.

· Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.

· Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and able to communicate with all levels of the business.

· Bilingual in is preferred.

· High tolerance for stress and ability to demonstrate sound judgment and decision- making under pressure.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

· Manages the food safety and quality programs (SQF)

· Manages all product and raw material hold & releases.

· Manages all validation, and verification activities.

· Manages the Complaint Program and reports to management on a weekly basis

· Demonstrates consistent logic, between quick decisiveness and slower, more

thorough approaches, i.e., is neither indecisive nor a hip-shooter. Shows

common sense. Anticipates consequences of decisions.

· Seeks out and seizes opportunities, goes beyond the “call of duty."

· Actively and successfully trains and coaches people for current assignments and develops them for promotion into positions in which they succeed. Provides challenging assignments.

· Determines opportunities and threats through comprehensive analysis of

current and future trends.

· Is the Backup HACCP coordinator, backup FSPCA, backup SQF and backup Internal Auditor for the bakery.

· Oversees employee disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations.

· Provide support and assistance to Senior Management backup to Director of Quality

and Quality Systems Supervisor

· Manages the Complaint Program and reports to management on a weekly basis.

· Supports the Crisis management team and supports any crisis that may arise.

· Manages the Environmental program(s) (a)Yeast & Mold b) Listeria c) Salmonella d) Water and Air

· Manages the entire training program for the bakery.

· Ensures all water and air supply documentation is up to date and works closely with the

· maintenance department ensuring program is on a preventative maintenance program for the bakery.

· Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Afterschool ABA Behavior Technician Monmouth County (S)
description:
Sunshine Advantage is hiring Behavior Technicians In Monmouth County New Jersey. Locations include Keyport, Keansburg, Highlands, Middletown, Milltown, Monroe

**Position Summary:**

The Behavior Technician is a clinical team member and receives supervision per the leading BCBA. Work consists of providing 1:1 therapy with patients, assisting the BCBA in completing consultations, parent training, collaboration with other team members under the BCBA supervision regarding the assessments, data collection, creating program materials, and other assigned activities. In addition, a professional commitment to working with clients and families for an extended period is expected.

**Benefits of working at Sunshine Advantage:**

Part time flexible schedules – Employees can easily combine this part time position with a full time day job conveniently located near their preferred location

Online and on the job training

Support and assistance obtain to earn credentials to advance your career

to becoming a Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)

Supervised Field experience for individuals working towards becoming a BCBA or BCaBA

Referral Bonus

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Provide 1:1 ABA therapy to children under the clinical supervision of a BCBA or BCaBA.

Follow behavior, individualized treatment plans, and reinforcements as determined by the supervising BCBA.

Complete daily acquisition skills, maintenance, and mastered skills treatment activities.

Implement appropriate teaching strategies and behavior modification approaches stated in the treatment program.

Collect accurate data daily.

Complete billing documentation with parents' signatures.

Attends staff meetings and training as requested.

Completes additional job duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):**

High School Diploma, GED

Experience with children with special needs, developmental delays, and/or autism

Training coursework is provided for those that do not have RBT certification.

Confidentiality and discretion pertaining to the work environment and HIPAA requirements are required.

Adhere to Ethical Guidelines set forth by the BACB organization

Obtain or possess updated CPR certification and maintain re-certification every two years

Ability to develop positive working relationships with children, families, employees, and departments, maintaining collaborative professional relationships.

Professionalism and timely communication as outlined by the company.

Background Clearance is mandatory.

Excellent and positive verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

title: Cover Teacher-Primary
company: Nord Anglia International School New York
description:
Please apply using the link below:

https://careers.nordangliaeducation.com/job-invite/2837/

**Nord Anglia Education**

Nord Anglia Education is the world’s leading premium schools organisation. We are a fast-paced and growing family of over 80+ international schools in China, Europe, the Middle East, South East Asia and North America, providing outstanding education to over 70,000 students from preschool through to the end of secondary education. Our schools are united by one philosophy - we are ambitious for our students, our people and our family of schools.

Each Nord Anglia Education school is unique in character and designed to meet the needs of its community. We believe that being part of our family of 80+ schools gives each school a special advantage. Working together, we can achieve more than we can individually. We also create unique opportunities to benefit our students and people such as the Global Campus, Nord Anglia University, and our collaborations with The Juilliard School, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and King’s College London reflect, all reflective of our ambitions to learn from the best.

**Nord Anglia International School New York (NAISNY)**

Nestled in the heart of the iconic East Village, New York, and with a strong community of local and international families, the school benefits from being situated in one of the most vibrant cities in the world. We offer a truly engaging global education for students aged 2 – 14 years from over 40 countries, based on the rigorous standards of the English National Curriculum. NAINSY has a strong ambition to grow over the next few years based on our vision to empower our diverse community to be globally responsible, achieve ambitions and thrive on their chosen paths.

Our students and staff benefit from excellent facilities, with space for academics, sports and creative arts. Classrooms are light and spacious with the resources to inspire our students to be creative and explore every learning opportunity. As part of a supportive and talented team, NAISNY offers opportunities to work with engaged students and to collaborate with the very best teachers in school and organizations across the Nord Anglia family.

Our students and staff can take advantage of the unique opportunities afforded to them by being New York City, including our Nord Anglia Collaborations with UNICEF and Juilliard, as well as being situated close to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in Boston.

NAISNY students belong to sections of the school dependent on their ages - Early Years (2s – Reception), Lower School (Year 1 – Year 4) and Upper School (Year 5-Year 9), with specialist teachers working across the school to deliver high quality leaning in Dance, Drama, Music, Art, PE, and Spanish.

To learn more about our outstanding students, staff, school, and supportive community, please visit Naisny.com

Please use the below link to apply and to view job description:

https://careers.nordangliaeducation.com/job-invite/2837/

title: Reverse Mortgage Closer
description:
**Company Description**  

Longbridge Financial, LLC (LBF) is an innovative company committed to responsibly helping senior homeowners reshape their financial future to improve their retirement. Our mission is to be consistently fair, transparent, and professional at all times with our employees, customers, and partners.


Recognized as an Industry Changemaker, Longbridge CEO Chris Mayer looks at the industry differently and values employees at all levels who drive our company forward. In fact, we are now a top 2 reverse mortgage lender.

**Why work with us?**


At Longbridge Financial, “We do the right thing” is more than a mantra, it’s our guarantee. We want to attract the best and brightest—that’s why we’re committed to giving our employees the support they need and the respect they deserve. We offer competitive compensation packages and benefits, as well as a strong marketing and operations foundation. Join us for a rewarding career with remarkable growth potential. **Ready to be a changemaker and be a part of a team to help propel Longbridge to number one?**

 **Job Description**  

The Reverse Mortgage Closer is responsible for several key functions in the process of preparing and finalizing all loan-closing documents and ensuring accuracy to have a fully compliant mortgage. This role requires diligence, strong organizational skills, and thorough understanding of mortgage documents and processes, a high level of accuracy and attention to details. This role can be in-office, hybrid or remote.

**Primary Job Duties:**

* Reviewing Loan Files: After loan approval, the Closer reviews the loan file to ensure all necessary documents are present and accurate. Pre-Closing review of all documents in file including title, homeowner’s insurance, appraisal, condominium documentation, tax certs, trust documents, payoffs, and disclosures.
* Auditing Loan Files: Complete a pre-closing checklist to ensure the file is complete and compliant with all regulations.
* Coordinating Loan Signings: Coordinate scheduled signing with partners, loan officers, settlement agents and/or title companies.
* Prepare Closing Documents: The Closer generates the closing documents required to close each file, ensuring the closing package is complete and accurate. The Closer will explain additional closing requirements to the settlement agent and all applicable parties as needed. The Closer will also coordinate shipping and receiving of documents to loan advisors, settlement agents, and wholesale partners, as needed. Perform client, settlement agent, processor, or client relations follow-up as applicable.
* Ensuring Timely Processing: Pipeline management to ensure all closing packages are completed in a timely manner, meeting all scheduled signing expectations.

 **Qualifications**  

* Minimum of three years as a Reverse Closing experience.
* Reverse mortgage industry experienced is preferred.
* Ability to prepare routine administrative paperwork.
* Organizing and coordinating skills
* Ability to develop and maintain files and records.
* Proficient in all aspects of various software applications: specifically, Internet Explorer, Microsoft Outlook, and Microsoft Word
* A strong understanding of customer service standards and procedures
* Must maintain a high level of service skills and reliability

  

**Additional Information**  

* Full benefits
* 401(k) with company match
* Paid time off
* Working in a growing and dynamic industry
* LBF is an EEO/AA/Vet/Disabled Employe
* *Please note that salaries that are estimated on various job sites may not reflect the actual compensations. Job sites, set the estimated salary, not Longbridge Financial.*

title: Patient Coordinator - Boutique Medical Practice - Allergy MD (LIC & BK)
description:
Allergy MD, a modern Allergy, Asthma and Immunology medical practice, is seeking a self-motivated, people-friendly Patient Coordinator for our (new, fun, beautiful) Brooklyn office and our established Long Island City office as needed.

Responsibilities

* Schedule, register, and perform follow up calls with patients
* Greet and attend to patients in person and over the phone
* Calls patients to schedule follow up appointments
* Keep doctors aware of requirements of insurance companies for all patients
* Manages the flow of patients in and out of exam rooms
* Professionally assist doctors, staff, visitors and patients
* Answer all phone calls and communication in a professional and courteous manner
* Collect copayments and verify insurance eligibility
* Liaise between medical departments with discretion and professionalism
* Setting up rooms and instruments; making sure there is a professional and clean environment for the patient and Physician
* Cleans and prepares all instruments in the exam rooms, keeps exam rooms stocked with supplies and samples, makes sure rooms are ready for next day visits
* Checks inventory and orders replacements when needed
* Manages hazardous wastes, and medical equipment. Performs routine maintenance for certain medical equipment
* Fills all shortages of medical supplies with reorders, fills out all necessary paperwork when ordering
* Ad-hoc projects and tasks

Growth and management opportunities available for those capable and interested.

Job Requirements:

Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus.

title: Phlebotomist - Oncology
description:
About Our Company
We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.
Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.
When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.
Job Description
This is a full time position: Monday - Friday, 8:30am - 5pm with rotating Saturday shifts (7am - 3:30pm)
Essential Job functions:* Uses appropriate aseptic technique to draw blood cultures.
* Processes Stat specimens according to Summit Health SOP.
* Prepares collection containers with appropriate preservatives for patients and gives instructions for proper collection of specimens at home (Urine & Stool). Properly measures and records a volume for a 24-hr collection.
* Properly collects a COC Urine Drug Screen.
* Properly administers and collects a H. pylori Breath test.
* Properly handles orders on minors.
* Uses the correct procedure for completing paperwork and labeling of specimen for OVH Blood Bank specimens.
* Processes satellite specimens and delivers them to the appropriate department.
* Monitors inventory levels and follows appropriate protocol for replenishing supplies in phlebotomy room and storage area.
* Deletes/cancels orders as necessary with full documentation of reason. Ensures proper patient charge deletion according to departmental policy.
* Recalls patients for follow-up procedures or error correction as required. Documents callbacks in the lab logbook.
* Utilizes LIS for all applicable functions to perform job duties, including downtime procedures.
* Adapts work schedule to meet emergency staffing needs.
* Required Competencies:
	+ Demonstrates competency in all areas of adult phlebotomy\\*
	+ Demonstrates competency in all areas of pediatric phlebotomy\\*
	+ Demonstrates competency in all areas of infant phlebotomy\\*
	+ Demonstrates competency in performing skin punctures\\*
	+ Demonstrates competency in performing bleeding times including entering the result in the LIS and the logbook.
		
			* Includes: Correct Order of Draw for multiple tube collection, using good judgment in evaluating specimens using established protocol, and demonstrating application of an adequate bandage to puncture site with explanation of puncture site care to patient.


General Job functions:* Properly check-in a patient in a satellite lab, including arriving the patient on the day-list.
* Properly process lab and office collected specimens for transport to the main lab by courier.
* Contact a courier for a Stat pickup in a satellite office.
* Properly perform, log, and enter a result for a Rapid Strep and or Hemoccult test in the LIS. Notifies physician of critical (positive) result.
* Trains new staff in proper lab policies and procedures.
* Other job duties as required.


Physical Job Requirements:* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking)


Environmental Risks:* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients / Visitors


Blood-borne Pathogens:* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens is possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.


Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Minimum of 2 years of phlebotomy experience required and drug screen collection preferred.
* Has the ability to perform all testing required at our satellite locations.
* Phlebotomy Technician Certification through the National Health Career Association (NHA) preferred; may be required for specific locations based on operational needs.
* CLA Certificate preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology, HIPAA guidelines and laboratory requirements to include skills in phlebotomy techniques with adult, pediatric, and geriatric patients, computer/data entry skills and phone etiquette are required.
* Attention to detail, ability to critically think, multitask, and maintain accuracy during periods of frequent interruptions in a fast-paced environment.
* Consistently demonstrate the ability to communicate in a clear and effective manner and read/follow procedures accurately.


Travel:* Travel to satellite locations as needed.

description:
About Our Company

Position Summary:
The Medical Assistant (MA) is responsible for assisting physicians, PA, or NP with clerical duties, patient flow, patient care, and procedures.  

Essential Job Functions:* Prepares the examination room. Escorts patient into the room. Cleans examination room when the exam is complete.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visits.
* Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visits.
* Communicates & provides care consistent with the age, cultural, spiritual, and developmental needs of the patient.
* Answers the telephone in an appropriate manner. Directs calls and/or takes accurate messages.
* Schedules appointments accurately and appropriately according to departmental guidelines.
* Consistently and accurately stocks examination rooms with all necessary supplies.
* Assists in ordering and maintaining all supplies as assigned.
* Reconciles encounters daily and accurately, according to policy guidelines.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns, or issues to the Supervisor and/or Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Understands and performs within the scope of practice.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Reviews and updates medication list and accurately documents knew allergies in the Electronic Health Record (EHR). Demonstrates an understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures.
* Accurately documents allergies in EHR.
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment, troubleshoot, and reports malfunctions promptly
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules.
* All other duties as assigned
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned.
* Provide scribing services.


General Job Functions:* Other duties as assigned


Physical Job Requirements:* Physical mobility, which includes movement from place to place on the job, taking distance and speed into account.
* Physical agility, which includes the ability to maneuver the body while in place.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers.
* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking).


Environmental Risks:* Allergens: dust, mold, and/or pollen
* Combative Patients / Visitors


Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:* High School Graduate/GED / Equivalent Work or Vocational / Technical School / Diploma, required. Associate Degree’s preferred.
* 0-1 year related work experience, required. 2-4 years related work experience, preferred.
* Medical Assistant certification, required
* Basic Life Support (BLS) or within 30 days of hire, required
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing, required
* Ability to organize and perform multiple tasks in a timely manner, required
* Basic proficiency in computer use, required
* Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed, required


Travel:* Travel to satellite locations as needed

title: Assistant Coach, Women's Volleyball
description:
**Lehman College | Assistant Coach | Women’s Volleyball**

Lehman College, a member of the City University of New York Athletic Conference (CUNYAC) and Division III of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA), seeks candidates for its next assistant women’s volleyball coach. This individual will oversee all aspects of a successful program, including but not limited to successful student-athlete recruitment, scouting, and practice and game planning. Recruiting ability and knowledge of NCAA compliance, rules, and regulations are vital to success in the role. Ability to recruit and foster culture of academic compliance and academic success are imperative. College coaching experience and experience recruiting in New York City and/or urban institutions and club programs is a plus.

Candidates should have a bachelor’s degree and coaching experience, preferably at the college level or as a head coach at the local club or high school level. Must possess a valid driver’s license. This is a part-time position that includes out-of-season responsibilities such as recruiting students into enrollment and communicating with student-athletes and staff. Review of applications is ongoing and successful candidate will begin immediately.

*Lehman College and CUNY encourage people with disabilities, minorities, veterans and women to apply. At Lehman and CUNY, Italian Americans are also included among our protected groups. Applicants and employees will not be discriminated against on the basis of any legally protected category, including sexual orientation or gender identity. EEO/AA/Vet/Disability Employer*

Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Machine Operator to join the Data Center Power &

Control Division in Farmingdale, NY. This role is a skilled position responsible for operating an

AMADA press brake during our second shift – from 3:30pm to Midnight.

Why apply?

Competitive Salary - Between 18-20 dollars an hour

10 paid holidays

The ability to accrue 10 Paid Vacation Days

Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage

Working for a growing global manufacturer with room for advancement

The ability to take your skills to the next level and work as a Press Brake Operator

What Will You Do?

 You will operate the press brake machine to shape sheet metal and inspect the resulting

product

 Perform brake operations on AMADA style brake machinery

 Read and interpret mechanical drawings or fabrication prints to determine the

measurements and operate the press brake to cut and bend materials into shapes

 Use Safety precautions and adhere to all company safety regulations

 Perform “in-process” inspections to prove dimensional tolerance and document it.

 Perform preventative maintenance on assigned brake press equipment.

 Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.

 Inform supervisor of any part or equipment defects to ensure prompt response to the

problem.

 Follow instructions as provided by supervisor.

 Maintain cleanliness and organization of assigned work area.

 Other duties as assigned.

What you bring?

 High School diploma or equivalent is required.

 A minimum of a year of experience in machine operation in a manufacturing

environment is required.

 Sheet metal precision press brake operation experience is preferred.

Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:

 Ability to read and interpret blueprints or mechanical drawings

 Knowledge or willingness to learn how to operate AMADA style Brake machinery or

AMADA ASTRO robotic brake machinery.

 Ability to operate machines safely and properly.

 Familiarity with shop equipment such as table, panel and chop saws and kick and drill

presses.

 Ability to work overtime when required.

 Ability to arrive promptly for shift and stand and/or walk for duration of shift is

required.

 Ability to hear, speak, kneel, bend and use a step ladder or stool is required.

 Ability to lift 45 pounds is required.

 Ability to work in a manufacturing environment is required.
